Issues.Title: fix(ivy): avoid innerHTML usage in exports test (to make it work in IE11)
Issues.Body:
Some tests in exports spec rely on the exact output of innerHTML. In IE11 the order of attributes might change, thus causing tests to fail (in case an element contains more than one attribute). This commit avoids innerHTML usage and performs the necessary checks via element properties.


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): avoid innerHTML usage in exports test (to make it work in IE11)" (#29127)

Issues.Title: test(ivy): fix export tests to work in IE
Issues.Body:
Some of the export tests had assertions that relied on capitalization
of attributes in the DOM. IE treats capitalization somewhat differently,
so our SauceLabs tests were failing.

This commit tweaks the tests so that the assertions do not rely on
attributes to be capitalized or not.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test(ivy): fix export tests to work in IE" (#29125)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): properly detect "inputs" and "outputs" field names that should be wrapped in quotes
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, the RegExp that was used to check for dashes in field names used "g" (global) flag that retains lastIndex, which might result in skipping some fields that should be wrapped in quotes (since lastIndex advanced beyond the next "-" location). This commit removes this flag and updates the test to make sure there are no regressions.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): properly detect "inputs" and "outputs" field names that should be wrapped in quotes" (#29126)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): never use imported type references as values
Issues.Body:
ngtsc occasionally converts a type reference (such as the type of a
parameter in a constructor) to a value reference (argument to a
directiveInject call). TypeScript has a bad habit of sometimes removing
the import statement associated with this type reference, because it's a
type only import when it initially looks at the file.

A solution to this is to always add an import to refer to a type position
value that's imported, and not rely on the existing import.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): never use imported type references as values" (#29111)

Issues.Title: ci: saucelabs-legacy job should not run schematic core tests
Issues.Body:
With 62157990554306fb76e1e254b31855f966ff65f2 we introduced schematics for `core`, but due to
the fact the Saucelabs legacy job does not run for PRs, we didn't realize
that the legacy Saucelabs job ends up running the schematic specs.

We don't want to run these schematic tests in the legacy-saucelabs job,
as these are node-only specs and the non-Bazel Karma setup is not set
up to provide the devkit schematic node modules.

We exclude the schematics folder in the `core` package in the
legacy-build tsconfig file (similar to how it is done for elements)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: saucelabs-legacy job should not run schematic core tests" (#29124)

Issues.Title: Wildcard animations do not work in Firefox
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/animations ### Is this a regression? Seems like a regression. Can reproduce same behavior with v6.1.10 of the animations module. ### Description Wildcard animation transitions do not work in Firefox (including latest v65). The animation fails silently. The same wildcard does work in Chrome and Safari. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-b4xmnb?file=src/app/app.component.ts Open the above in Firefox. In this example, note that the animation padding value in app.component.ts is set to '*'. The animation does not run and fails silently. Change the padding value to something like '2rem' and observe the animation completing just fine. If you open the example in Chrome or Safari, it runs fine. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
v7.2.7
**Anything else relevant?** Firefox v65 Tested on macOS Mojave, version 10.14.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wildcard animations do not work in Firefox" (#29121)

Issues.Title: feat(platform-server): wait on returned BEFORE_APP_SERIALIZED promises
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

Render does not wait on any returned promises from `BEFORE_APP_SERIALIZED`.

## What is the new behavior?

This update gives external tooling the ability for async providers to
finish resolving before the document is serialized. This is not a
breaking change since render already returns a promise. All returned
promises from `BEFORE_APP_SERIALIZED` providers will wait to be
resolved or rejected. Any rejected promises will only console.warn().

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(platform-server): wait on returned BEFORE_APP_SERIALIZED promises" (#29120)

Issues.Title: ci: bazel saucelabs test job does not setup circleci bazelrc
Issues.Body:
Currently the `test_saucelabs` job does not use our general
CircleCI bazel configuration. We should set this configuration
up, as it enables better logging, better use of the `xlarge`
resource class, and also sets up Bazel's integrated flakiness
retry functionality.

Issues.Title: Using href is not routing angular routes in AngularJS and Angular 7 Hybrid App
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router or other angular core packages ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 4.x ### Description We have a Hybrid App (AngularJS and Angular7) which has a mix of AngularJS and Angular7 routers. When we try to switch between routes (components) in Angular7 with href, only every second route is routing fine, that means one in between is always skipped. This problem is only in Firefox and Safari and NOT in Chrome. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The original code that works fine is from Manfred Steyer: https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngUpgrade-without-preparation. This code is using Angular 4.x. You can find the upgraded code from Angular 4.x to Angular 7.x which describes the problem in repo: https://github.com/dorje42/ngUpgrade-without-preparation This is a Hybrid App, which has AngularJS and Angular7 Routers. Routing between Angular7 routes with **routerLink** is working fine. But Routing between Angular7 routes using **href** routes only every second route, that means one in between is always skipped. Routing with href in a standard Angular7 App is working fine: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-puqxtw?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html There must be something wrong with the hybrid app constellation. open http://localhost:4200/ 1. click ng2-route (href), it will go to http://localhost:4200/#/ng2-route 2. click ng7-route (href), nothing happens 3. click ng8-route (href), it will go to http://localhost:4200/#/ng8-route 4. click ng2-route (href), nothing happens 5. click ng7-route (href), it will go to http://localhost:4200/#/ng7-route ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 7.3.4
Node: 8.11.3
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, upgrade

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.4
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.4
@angular/cli                      7.3.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.4
@schematics/angular               7.3.4
@schematics/update                0.13.4
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?** This problem is only in Firefox and Safari and NOT in Chrome.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using href is not routing angular routes in AngularJS and Angular 7 Hybrid App" (#29113)

Issues.Title: Revert prettier
Issues.Body: precise-commits' usage of the range options of prettier is not a currently fully support use case for prettier.  The range options appear to be intended to be used with hand-picked ranges at well-defined code borders with an emphasize on performance situations with massive files; and not arbitrary ranges as provided by git commit logs.  This results in errant formatting due to the isolated ranges selected by precise-commits not having sufficient AST context.  There also appears to be an issue regarding partial (ranged) JSON files not being interpreted as JSON.  Further upstream work will be needed to re-integrated precise-commits.  A followup PR may re-introduce prettier on its own as more detailed range support would require a feature addition at the prettier level which would then need to be leveraged by precise-commits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Revert prettier" (#13823)

Issues.Title: Improve name validation with component schematic (and others)
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [X] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

Using dots in component name when using component schematic (might also happen with other schematics) should fail. I.e. `ng generate component a.b.x` should fail.

I noticed that people who are new to Angular tend to use the schematic like this for the first time:
```sh
ng generate component hello-world.component
```
which produces something funky like this:
```ts
export class HelloWorld.ComponentComponent
```


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

Use some whitelist regex to check the component's name before.

By the way, why does the component's selector allow dots in the regular expression below?
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/eca5dc322f11360b82309c31ed6a716a894fc051/packages/schematics/angular/utility/validation.ts#L20

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
```sh
ng generate component hello-world.component
echo D'OH!
git reset --hard
git clean -d -f
ng generate component hello-world
```

Anyway, I am in for a pull request.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): respect `preserveSymlinks` when using `bundleDependencies` in server builder
Issues.Body:
- fix(@angular-devkit/core): `resolve` should not use realpaths when `preserveSymlinks` is false
At the moment, certain places in the logic still return realpaths
 
- fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): respect `preserveSymlinks` when using `bundleDependencies` in server builder

`require.resolve` will always return the realpath, unless the process has been started with `NODE_PRESERVE_SYMLINKS`

More info here: https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#cli_node_preserve_symlinks_1

Hence, we should the `resolve` mechanism implemented in core as this is similar to `require.resolve` but with extra options. One of them being `preserveSymlinks`

Fixes #13817
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): respect `preserveSymlinks` when using `bundleDependencies` in server builder" (#13819)

# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description I developed lib which has follow structure -catalogs --src ---lib ----components -----component1 ------component1.component.ts -----component2 ------component2.component.ts -----index.ts ----catalogs.module.ts index.ts in components groups all components into arrays: 
import { Component1 } from "./component1/component1.component";

import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';

@NgModule({

Issues.Title: Build of server side bundle is combining to the bundle packages which are linked.
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [x] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description Build of server side bundle is combining to the bundle packages which are linked (`npm link xyz`). Same package, if is just installed (`npm i xyz`) is just referenced by `require`. This cause a problems with few workflows like auto server side restart by `nodemon`, debugging, ect. It is confusing that build is handling same package in two different ways. Build should handle in same way packages which are under `node_modules`, no matter haw that modules are installed. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. `ng init abc` 2. `cd abc` 3. `npm i uuid @types/uuid` (this is just example of some 3Party package, but it can be any other) 4. create file `src/main-server.ts`: ``` import {v4} from 'uuid'; console.log(v4()); ``` 5. create file `src/tsconfig.server.json`: ``` { "extends": "../tsconfig.json", "compilerOptions": { "outDir": "../out-tsc/server", "module": "commonjs" } } ``` 6. in `angular.json` under the `projects/abc/architect` add: ``` ... "server": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:server", "options": { "bundleDependencies": "none", <-- this doesn't help :( "preserveSymlinks": true, "outputPath": "dist/server", "main": "src/main-server.ts", "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.server.json", "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts", "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts" } ] } } ... ``` 7. call `ng run abc:server`, generated bundle is 4.55 kB and contains just reference to `uuid` package: ``` /***/ "uuid": /*!***********************!*\ !*** external "uuid" ***! \***********************/ /*! no static exports found */ /***/ (function(module, exports) { module.exports = require("uuid");/***/ }) /******/ }))); ``` 8. now clone the package `git clone https://github.com/kelektiv/node-uuid.git -- node-uuid` 9. link cloned package by `npm link` instde cloned repo 10. under the abc project link uuid package by `npm link uuid` 11. build bundle again by `ng run abc:server`, now bundle size is 11.2 kB and it contains content of linked package ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 7.3.4
Node: 10.15.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.4
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.4

@schematics/angular               7.3.4
@schematics/update                0.13.4

Issues.Title: Differentially loaded polyfill naming is confusing
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
Currently the differentially loaded polyfills are named something like this:
`es2015-polyfills.93d33834f014c18240da.js`
`polyfills.13391cdb066748d88c83.js`

These names are a little confusing because one might guess that the es2015 one is loaded by modern browsers, and the other one is loaded by legacy browsers, but this isn't what happens.

Today, the `es2015-polyfills.js` is loaded by browsers that DON'T support ES2015, and the file marked ES2015 is **ACTUALLY ES5**.

### Proposals
I propose to instead name the legacy file based on what it contains in a way that makes it clearer by using an additional file extension. The modern one can stay the same this way.

`polyfills.es5.js` - Contains ES5 and is intended for older browsers
`polyfills.js` - Contains modern JS and is intended for modern browsers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Differentially loaded polyfill naming is confusing" (#13808)

# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [x] test - [x] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, unsure what build ### Description Running any cli task that outputs progress will show each step on a new line. This was previously working where it would update the current line. I'm unsure if this is an angular cli problem, a vs code problem or windows problem. To note, the progress works fine on my work desktop, which is running windows 10. This only seems to affect my home desktop also running Windows 10. Direction on the culprit would help and I re-create this in the relevant locations repo, if this isn't an angular problem. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Running ng test, ng e2e or ng build will result in this. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24984762/53664553-debda700-3cbc-11e9-8bb4-56a3ecc32795.png) ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [X] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
TypeScript compiler has been great so far, but showed some limitations especially when it comes to transpiling ES6 third party modules to ES5. This can be a pretty big issue when developers have requirements with older browsers, or simply want (or need) their website to pass the Google Crawler without any issue, such as "**Unexpected token "=>"**". This issue is also showing on older browsers.

### Describe the solution you'd like
This is a problem that can be solved by using babel to transpile ES6 module to ES5, and @babel/preset-typescript to transpile TypeScript to ES5 as well.

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Generate apps building with babel and @babel/preset-typescript instead of tsc." (#13806)

Issues.Body:

Closes #11816

Issues.Title: chore: update master to angular version 8 beta
Issues.Body:
This allows us to cherry-pick @kara's static query updates from the
`ivy-2019` branch.

This change includes:
* Adding missing dependencies for various Angular subpackages
* Add umd assets where they are now necessary
* Configure bazel to target ES5 output as a workaround for https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/29107
* Updates most npm dependencies to the @npm// workspace
* Updates general workspace setup, RBE config, ngcontainer
* Update to rxjs 6.4.0 (building from source no longer needed)
* Added rxjs_shims for ts_web_test and ts_devserver targets
* Removed index.bzl and angular_material_setup_workspace (not needed anymore since material won't be built from source)
* Use browser_repositories() from @npm_bazel_karma which have pinned browsers that work on all platforms
* Change dgeni processor functions from arrow function to `function` to
work around `@npm//di` not supporting arrow functions

cc @gregmagolan
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore: update master to angular version 8 beta" (#15392)

Issues.Title: Incorrect position when dragging element inside a boundary
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

When the child element inside the boundary is selected for the first time, it suddenly jumps on the bottom right of the container.

#### What is the expected behavior?

The selected element should stay at the same position relative to the cursor.

#### What is the current behavior?

It jumps on the bottom right of the container.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

This file shows an example. If we have a parent container and a child inside with a boundary limited to the parent, the jumping bottom right will occur.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

In my case this is for an educational mini game.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular : 7.2.5,
CDK: 7.3.3,
Browsers: All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect position when dragging element inside a boundary" (#15383)

Issues.Title: mat-select options overlay shifted left when first child element is a mat-optgroup
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Options overlay renders at the same position regardless its first child element

#### What is the current behavior?
When a mat-select's first child element is a mat-optgroup (vs a mat-option), the options overlay is shifted to the left. This is more noticeable when combined with a mat-form-field's appearance="outline"

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hskr5f?file=app%2Fselect-optgroup-example.html

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.7
Angular Material 7.3.1
macOS 10.14.3
Chrome 72.0.3626.119
Firefox 65.0.1
Safari 12.0.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select options overlay shifted left when first child element is a mat-optgroup" (#15382)

Issues.Title: mat-table, multiTemplate, matSort: expanding issue after sort
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
After sorting, I expect the row expand when I click on it.

#### What is the current behavior?
The expand action works fine until records are sorted.
After the sort action, and if the row has never been expanded, the expand row appears only after 3 click.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz Demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-issue-table-multitemplate-sort?embed=1&file=src/app/app.component.html)
1. Click on a row. The row expands correctly.
2. Sort the records.
3. Click on a never expanded row, the row didn't expand.
4. Click again, the row didn't expand.
4. Click again, the row expands.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular: 7.2.7
Material: 7.3.3
TypeScript: 3.1.1
Browsers: Google Chrome

#### Is there anything else we should know?
No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-table, multiTemplate, matSort: expanding issue after sort" (#15380)

Issues.Title: Layout of docs page is broken
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Docs page text to be responsive, adjusting to the width of the browser window.

#### What is the current behavior?
Text is overflowing the browser window and no horizontal scrollbar is visible.
When viewing that page on an iPad it won't let you scroll down.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Go to [https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview](https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview) and resize your browser window. Or open that page on an iPad.
![untitled-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5860703/53680747-f35f6680-3cdf-11e9-83fc-95e6392ef09b.jpg)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Layout of docs page is broken" (#15363)

Issues.Title: package.json doesn't allow installation of Angular version 8 prerelease
Issues.Body:
Steps:
Take a 7.x project with Material installed.
ng update @angular/core @angular/cli --next

#### What is the expected behavior?
Angular is updated and Material is left at 7.x

#### What is the current behavior?
```
ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --next
                  Package "@angular/material" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/animations" (requires ">=7.0.0", would install "8.0.0-beta.6").
                  Package "@angular/material" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/common" (requires ">=7.0.0", would install "8.0.0-beta.6").
                  Package "@angular/material" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/core" (requires ">=7.0.0", would install "8.0.0-beta.6").
```

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Material 7.x

#### Is there anything else we should know?
https://jubianchi.github.io/semver-check/#/%3E7.0.0/8.0.0-beta.0
The comparison in package.json to >7.0.0 doesn't match 8.0.0-beta.0 of Angular :(
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "package.json doesn't allow installation of Angular version 8 prerelease" (#15376)

Issues.Title: Unable to get selected value out of dynamically created mat-select without falling back to NativeControl
Issues.Body:
# What is the expected behavior?

Being able to get the selected value out of a dynamically created mat-select control with document.getNativeElement or any other way

**WITHOUT USING NATIVECONTROL**, as it is being drawn completely different from the mat-select!

Using NativeControl **IS NOT THE SOLUTION!**

# What is the current behavior?
NativeElement created by mat-select does not hold the selected value

# What are the steps to reproduce?

```
<mat-form-field>
<mat-select id={{column.columnName}} placeholder="{{column.columnName|translate|capitalize}}">
<mat-option *ngFor="let foreignRow of foreignDataMap[getForeignTableName(column.columnName)]" [value]="foreignRow.uid">
 {{foreignRow.value}}
</mat-option>
</mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```
```
var element = document.getElementById( column.columnName ) as HTMLInputElement;

element.value <-- does not exist
```
# Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All latest.

# Is there anything else we should know?

Yes, please **STOP CLOSING** this issue **without providing the bugfix**! 

Mixing nativeControl with mat controls is **unacceptable**, UI looks absolutely wrong.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to get selected value out of dynamically created mat-select without falling back to NativeControl" (#15374)

Moving and dragging the item at window top or bottom bounds will scroll in that direction.

Latest versions

No

Issues.Title: docs(drag-drop): add docs and live example for delay input
Issues.Body:
Adds some docs and a live example for the `cdkDragStartDelay` input. Follow-up from #14732.

**Note:** targeting `major`, because the PR that introduces the functionality was merged into the next major branch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(drag-drop): add docs and live example for delay input" (#15370)

Issues.Title: fix(checkbox): clear name from host node
Issues.Body: Currently we forward the name attribute from the host node to the underlying input, however we leave the name on the host node intact. This can throw off functions like `document.getElementsByName` or the `By.name` Protractor selector.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(checkbox): clear name from host node" (#15368)

Issues.Title: Set button type dynamicaly
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
I'm using MatButton directive as attribute like this:
`<button mat-button buttonType="{{button.type}}></button>"`
I want to change 'mat-button' directive according to 'button.type', for example if 'button.type' is 'stroked' then 'mat-button' changed to 'mat-stroked-button'. How can to change type of button dynamicaly?

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Set button type dynamicaly" (#15367)

Issues.Title: refactor(autocomplete): rework cases not using document token
Issues.Body: Fixes a couple of places that were referring to the global `document` variable, rather than using the token. These could potentially throw on the server, if a code path somehow hit them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(autocomplete): rework cases not using document token" (#15366)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): alt + up arrow to close panel not working
Issues.Body: Currently we support the part of the spec where the autocomplete panel is supposed to close when pressing alt + up arrow, however at some point we added more functionality that ends up reopening the panel immediately. These changes ensure that the user is able to close the panel via alt + up arrow.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): alt + up arrow to close panel not working" (#15364)
